hypothesis_content.title: Neutral-to-Bear Regime Transition via Volatility Compression Break
hypothesis_content.statement: When BTC trades in a NEUTRAL regime with realized volatility (20D) below 40% and 30-day price range compression (<15% high-low range), a break below the 20-day low on >1.5x average volume signals a transition to BEAR regime with 70% probability within 5 days.
hypothesis_content.rationale: Extended low-volatility periods in neutral regimes often precede directional breaks. High-volume breaks of established support levels during compression suggest institutional selling and regime change initiation rather than noise.
entry_conditions: BTC 30-day high-low range < 15% of current price
Volume on break day > 1.5x 20-day average volume

exit_conditions.take_profit: 5% decline from entry OR regime classification switches to BEAR (confidence > 70%)

hypothesis_content.falsification_criteria: More than 30% of such signals fail to produce BEAR regime within 5 days OR breakouts reverse >60% of the time within 2 days.
